sections.heading: What is 〜らしい (rashii)?
sections.content:
〜らしい expresses inference or hearsay, meaning "apparently," "it seems," or "I hear." It indicates you've gathered information from various sources or made a conclusion based on evidence.

雨が降るらしい "Apparently it will rain / It seems it will rain" 彼は忙しいらしい "Apparently he's busy / He seems to be busy"

children.heading: With Verbs (Plain Form)
children.content: 降る → 降るらしい "apparently will rain" 降った → 降ったらしい "apparently rained" 降らない → 降らないらしい "apparently won't rain"

children.heading: With I-adjectives
children.content: 高い → 高いらしい "apparently expensive" 高かった → 高かったらしい "apparently was expensive" 高くない → 高くないらしい "apparently not expensive"

children.heading: With Na-adjectives
children.content: 便利 → 便利らしい "apparently convenient" 便利だった → 便利だったらしい "apparently was convenient" 便利じゃない → 便利じゃないらしい "apparently not convenient"

children.heading: With Nouns
children.content: 学生 → 学生らしい "apparently a student" 雨 → 雨らしい "apparently rain" 休み → 休みらしい "apparently a holiday"

children.heading: 1. Hearsay/Inference (apparently)
children.content:
Information gathered from indirect sources:

明日は雨らしい "Apparently it will rain tomorrow" 彼は結婚したらしい "Apparently he got married" そのレストランはおいしいらしい "That restaurant is apparently delicious"

children.heading: 2. Typical/Characteristic (-like)
children.content:
Something is typical or characteristic of its kind:

春らしい天気 "spring-like weather" 学生らしい質問 "a student-like question" 彼らしい考え方 "a way of thinking typical of him"

children.heading: Indicating Information Source
children.content: 噂によると、彼は転勤するらしい "According to rumors, he's apparently transferring" ニュースで見たけど、明日は寒いらしい "I saw on the news, apparently it will be cold tomorrow"

children.heading: Softer than そうだ
children.content:
らしい is slightly less direct than そうだ for hearsay:

More direct: 雨が降るそうだ "I heard it will rain" Softer: 雨が降るらしい "Apparently it will rain / It seems it will rain"

children.heading: らしい vs そうだ (hearsay)
children.content: らしい: Vague/multiple sources 彼は忙しいらしい "He's apparently busy" (I've heard/gathered) そうだ: Clear, specific source 彼は忙しいそうだ "I heard he's busy" (someone told me)

children.heading: らしい vs みたい vs ようだ
children.content: らしい: Hearsay/inference 雨が降るらしい "Apparently it will rain" みたい: Personal observation/similarity 雨が降るみたい "It looks like it will rain" ようだ: Logical conclusion 雨が降るようだ "It appears it will rain"

children.heading: Noun + らしい = "like/typical of"
children.content: 春らしい天気 "spring-like weather" 彼らしい "typical of him / like him" 女性らしい "feminine / lady-like" 男性らしい "masculine / manly" 子供らしい "child-like / childish"

children.heading: 〜らしいです (polite)
children.content: 明日は雨らしいです "Apparently it will rain tomorrow" 彼は来ないらしいです "Apparently he won't come"

children.heading: 〜らしい (casual)
children.content: 明日は雨らしい "Apparently it will rain tomorrow" おいしいらしいよ "Apparently it's delicious"

children.heading: どうやら〜らしい (it appears)
children.content:
Emphasizes conclusion:

どうやら彼は来ないらしい "It appears he won't come" どうやら間違いらしい "It appears to be a mistake"

children.heading: With Verbs
children.content: 来ないらしい "Apparently won't come" 行かなかったらしい "Apparently didn't go"

children.heading: With Adjectives
children.content: おいしくないらしい "Apparently not delicious" 便利じゃないらしい "Apparently not convenient"

children.heading: Example 1: Weather
children.content: A: 明日の天気、知ってる？ "Do you know tomorrow's weather?" B: 雨らしいよ "Apparently rain" A: じゃあ、傘を持って行こう "Then let's bring umbrellas"

children.heading: Example 2: News
children.content: A: 田中さん、最近見ないね "I haven't seen Tanaka lately" B: 転勤したらしい "Apparently he transferred" A: そうなんだ "I see"

children.heading: Example 3: Restaurant
children.content: A: あの新しいレストラン、どう？ "How about that new restaurant?" B: おいしいらしいよ。みんな言ってる "Apparently it's delicious. Everyone says so" A: じゃあ、行ってみよう "Then let's try going"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Confusing meanings
children.content: Hearsay: 彼は学生らしい "He's apparently a student" Typical: 学生らしい質問 "A student-like question" Context determines meaning!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using だ before らしい with na-adjectives
children.content: Wrong: 便利だらしい ❌ Right: 便利らしい ✓ "Apparently convenient" But for past: Right: 便利だったらしい ✓ "Apparently was convenient"

children.heading: 〜らしくない (not typical of)
children.content: 彼らしくない "Not like him / uncharacteristic of him" 春らしくない天気 "Un-spring-like weather"

children.heading: 〜らしく (in a ~ manner)
children.content:
Adverb form:

男らしく振る舞う "Behave in a manly way" 学生らしく勉強する "Study like a student should"

children.heading: どうやら〜らしい
children.content: どうやら雨が降るらしい "It appears it will rain" どうやら間違いらしい "It appears to be a mistake"

children.heading: Present
children.content: 彼は忙しいらしい "He's apparently busy" 明日は雨らしい "Apparently it will rain tomorrow"

children.heading: Past
children.content: 昨日は雨だったらしい "Apparently it rained yesterday" 彼は忙しかったらしい "He was apparently busy"

children.heading: Less Certain
children.content: たぶん雨が降るらしい "Probably it will apparently rain" もしかしたら来ないらしい "Perhaps he apparently won't come"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: 雨らしい "Apparently rain" おいしいらしいよ "Apparently delicious"

children.heading: Polite
children.content: 雨らしいです "Apparently it's rain" おいしいらしいですよ "Apparently it's delicious"

children.heading: Seasons
children.content: 春らしい天気 "spring-like weather" 夏らしい暑さ "summer-like heat" 秋らしい涼しさ "autumn-like coolness"

children.heading: Gender (traditional usage)
children.content: 女性らしい "feminine / lady-like" 男性らしい "masculine / manly" Note: These can be considered stereotypical in modern usage

children.heading: Age Groups
children.content: 子供らしい "child-like" 大人らしい "adult-like / mature" 若者らしい "youth-like / young"

children.heading: Personal Character
children.content: 彼らしい "typical of him / like him" 彼女らしい "typical of her / like her" 自分らしい "true to oneself"

children.heading: Hearsay
children.content: 明日は雨らしい "Apparently it will rain tomorrow" 彼は結婚したらしい "Apparently he got married" そのレストランはおいしいらしい "That restaurant is apparently delicious" 会議は中止らしいです "The meeting is apparently cancelled"

children.heading: Past Hearsay
children.content: 昨日は暑かったらしい "Apparently it was hot yesterday" 彼は忙しかったらしい "He was apparently busy" パーティーは楽しかったらしい "The party was apparently fun"

children.heading: Negative
children.content: 彼は来ないらしい "Apparently he won't come" おいしくないらしい "Apparently it's not delicious" 便利じゃないらしい "Apparently it's not convenient"

children.heading: Typical/Characteristic
children.content: 春らしい天気ですね "It's spring-like weather, isn't it" 彼らしい考え方だ "That's a way of thinking typical of him" 学生らしい質問 "A student-like question" 自分らしく生きる "Live true to oneself"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜そう (sou) - Looks like / I heard 〜みたい (mitai) - Looks like/seems 〜ようだ (you da) - It appears/seems 〜っぽい (ppoi) - Seems like/tends to Reporting Speech - Hearsay patterns 〜によると - According to
